Climate change can alter rainfall erosivity due to alteration of rainfall patterns
17 . The increase in global mean temperature generates an increase in the moisture retention capacity of the atmosphere that is in the order of 7% per degree Celsius
18 . The addition of water vapor in the atmosphere influences climate circulation patterns, thus modifying the intensity, frequency and incidence of extreme rainfall events. In warm climates, such as in Brazil, temperature and extreme rainfall events will increase more significantly than in many other regions around the world
